intro: Trollius teshioensis, commonly known as the Teshio buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant is known for its ornamental value in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
